title: LME aluminium cash price rises to $2,780/t as opening stocks dip to 484,125t
summary: The London Metal Exchange (LME) aluminium cash price increased to $2,780 per tonne on October 21, supported by falling stocks and steady demand. LME aluminium opening stocks declined 0.62% to 484,125 tonnes, while cancelled warrants dropped sharply, signaling potential moderation in physical demand.

title: Aluminum reshoring hits energy wall as AI and data centres surge
summary: Efforts to reshore aluminum production to the US are facing challenges due to surging energy demand from AI and data centers, which is straining power grids and complicating plans to boost domestic aluminum output.

title: Aluminum Rises Toward 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum futures rose toward $2,730 per tonne in October, reaching the highest level in three years due to expectations of lower supply. Chinese authorities have cut their annual output growth target for base metals, including aluminum, to 1.5% annually for 2025 and 2026, down from 5%, aligning with an aluminum output cap of 45 million tons. Alcoa announced the shutdown of its Kwinana alumina refinery in Australia due to deteriorating bauxite grades, while global warehouse stocks of primary aluminum dropped in September.

title: US Aluminum Scrap Trade Faces 2025 Shake-Up Amid Tariffs and Global Demand
summary: The US aluminum scrap trade is undergoing significant changes in 2025 due to tariffs and shifting global demand. Imports of aluminum scrap into the US rose by 31% in the first half of 2025 compared to the previous year, despite a 25% aluminum import tariff introduced in March. This tariff has caused recyclers to increasingly rely on domestic scrap recovery rather than imports.

title: Jeep Factory Halted for Three Weeks After Aluminum Plant Fire
summary: A Stellantis NV plant in Michigan is shut down for several weeks due to a shortage of aluminum parts caused by a fire at a Novelis Inc. aluminum plant in Oswego, New York. The fire, which occurred on September 16, damaged the hot mill and other production areas, disrupting supply to automakers including Stellantis and Ford. Novelis expects to resume hot mill operations in the first quarter of 2026.

title: Governments Announce Support for Alcoa's Gallium Critical Mineral Development Project in Western Australia
summary: Alcoa is advancing a project to develop gallium, a critical mineral extracted from bauxite during alumina refining, with support from the US and Australian governments. Gallium is vital for technology and defense sectors. The project aims for a final investment decision and production in 2026, highlighting Alcoa's role in securing critical mineral supply chains linked to aluminum production.

title: Century Aluminum Reports Electrical Equipment Failure Affecting One Potline at Grundartangi, Iceland Smelter
summary: Century Aluminum reported an electrical equipment failure impacting one potline at its Grundartangi smelter in Iceland. The incident may affect aluminum production capacity at the facility, though specific details on the extent and duration of the impact were not provided.

title: Weekly Recap: Aluminium's low-carbon revolution in action
summary: RUSAL introduced an innovative electrochemical technology converting off-grade aluminium scrap into high-purity metal, advancing sustainability. Taural India and Vedanta Aluminium are implementing low-carbon and green sand-casting techniques to reduce emissions by up to 80%. Egypt's Dandara Solar Energy project aims to supply renewable energy to Egypt Aluminium, cutting greenhouse gas emissions by 30% and aligning with EU's CBAM mechanism.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices have surged to a three-year high driven by demand from EVs, solar, and grid upgrades, with new renewable-powered smelting projects expanding capacity globally. Major companies like Mercedes-Benz and Apple are securing low-carbon aluminum contracts to reduce supply chain emissions. The EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism and U.S. government funding are accelerating decarbonization and recycling infrastructure development in the aluminum sector.

title: 7 Critical Threats Facing the Global Aluminum Industry
summary: The aluminum industry faces challenges including carbon emissions, evolving regulations like the EU's CBAM, and rising production costs. The energy-intensive Hall-Héroult process contributes significantly to greenhouse gas emissions, prompting stricter regulatory scrutiny. Companies are responding by investing in emissions monitoring, engaging with policymakers, and forming coalitions to balance compliance with competitiveness.

title: Can circular aluminium provide a blueprint for a post-plastic world?
summary: Circular aluminium offers significant sustainability benefits due to its infinite recyclability and existing recycling infrastructure, contrasting with plastics' recycling challenges. Producing recycled aluminium requires only 5% of the energy of virgin production, substantially reducing emissions. Expanding circular aluminium use could support a sustainable economy and reduce reliance on plastics, though broader adoption and improved recycling rates are needed.

title: Printable aluminum alloy sets strength records, may enable lighter aircraft parts
summary: MIT engineers developed a new printable aluminum alloy that is five times stronger than traditional cast alloys and stable at high temperatures up to 400°C. The alloy's unique microstructure, enabled by rapid cooling in 3D printing, could lead to lighter, stronger aircraft parts. Machine learning techniques were used to optimize the alloy's properties, opening new possibilities for advanced manufacturing in aerospace.

title: Steel rose to 3,050 CNY/T on October 22, 2025, up 0.46% from the previous day
summary: Steel prices increased slightly to 3,050 CNY per ton on October 22, 2025, marking a 0.46% rise from the previous day. Despite this daily increase, steel prices have fallen 0.68% over the past month and are down 4.87% compared to the same time last year. Analysts expect steel prices to trade at around 3,008.71 Yuan/MT by the end of the quarter and forecast a decline to 2,875.97 Yuan/MT in 12 months.

title: SMM Stainless Steel Daily Review: SS Futures Slightly Recover, Testing 12,700 Yuan/mt
summary: Stainless steel futures showed a recovery with prices climbing to 12,700 yuan/mt, supported by a rise in metal futures overall. Spot market enquiries increased, and market confidence improved, leading to higher quotations despite cautiousness about high prices. Stainless steel planned production in October is expected to approach 3.45 million mt, although downstream demand recovery remains limited.

title: HRC Steel fell to 806.08 USD/T on October 22, 2025, down 0.85% from the previous day
summary: Hot Rolled Coil (HRC) steel prices declined by 0.85% to 806.08 USD per ton on October 22, 2025. Over the past month, HRC steel prices have fallen 2.65%, but remain 14.50% higher than a year ago. Forecasts suggest prices will rise to 829.86 USD/T by the end of the quarter and reach 893.93 USD/T within 12 months.

title: 2Q 2025 Cost Report: As Steel, Aluminum Tariffs Rise to 50%, Feds OK US Steel Sale to Nippon Steel
summary: The US government increased tariffs on steel and aluminum imports to 50%, aiming to curb surges of Chinese steel exports. The American Iron and Steel Institute supports the tariff hike amid growing global steel overcapacity and a downturn in Chinese construction. Nippon Steel's acquisition of US Steel includes plans to restart idled blast furnace capacity, which could moderate steel prices by increasing supply.

title: US scrap trends outlook: October 2025
summary: Ferrous scrap prices in the US are expected to continue declining in October 2025 due to softening demand. Market sentiment is bearish with an anticipated 3.6% month-on-month price drop, driven primarily by lower mill demand and macroeconomic headwinds. Inventories remain slightly below average, indicating supply constraints are unlikely to support prices.

title: US' raw steel production in week ending Oct 11 hikes y-o-y
summary: As of the week ending October 11, 2025, the adjusted year-to-date production of US raw steel reached 70.22 million net tons, marking a 2.5% increase compared to the same period last year. The weekly production was 1,722,000 net tons with a capability utilization rate of 76.0%, showing an 8.4% rise from the previous year.

title: China will ban new capacity and reduce steel production
summary: China has announced a work plan for 2025-26 to ban new steel capacity and reduce production to balance supply and demand in the steel industry. This move follows earlier promises to cut steel output and aims to enhance green, low-carbon, and digital development in the sector. Over 80% of China's crude steel production capacity has completed ultra-low-emission retrofits.

title: China's new pledge; electricity demand slows; steel overcapacity
summary: China released a plan for 2025-26 to ban new steel capacity and reduce production to balance supply and demand, emphasizing green and low-carbon development. The Ministry of Ecology and Environment expanded the national emissions trading scheme (ETS) to cover steel, cement, and aluminum sectors, covering 60% of China's emissions. The plan reflects efforts to address steel overcapacity and environmental concerns.

title: OECD Steel Outlook 2025
summary: The OECD reports that global steelmaking capacity is expected to increase by up to 6.7% (165 million metric tonnes) from 2025 to 2027, risking deeper excess capacity amid sluggish demand growth. Regional demand varies, with declines in China and steady demand in OECD countries, while ASEAN and MENA show growth. Subsidies, especially in China, distort competition and exacerbate overcapacity, impacting steel decarbonisation investments.

title: SPECIALTY STEEL INDUSTRY OF NORTH AMERICA APPLAUDS TRUMP ADMINISTRATION'S ACTIONS TO ADDRESS GLOBAL EXCESS STEEL CAPACITY
summary: The Specialty Steel Industry of North America praised the Trump Administration's efforts to counter global excess steel capacity, highlighting the negative impact of foreign government subsidies and non-market policies on U.S. producers. The industry urges collective action among Global Forum on Steel Excess Capacity members to develop a new framework to resolve excess capacity issues.

title: The Global Steel Industry 2025: At a Pivotal Crossroads
summary: The steel industry is undergoing major foundational changes driven by AI integration, new hydrogen methods, automation, and sustainability. AI is enhancing efficiency and reducing errors through predictive maintenance and real-time optimization, while green steel production is gaining momentum as nations push for zero emissions.

title: Green steel revolution: navigating a new frontier in 2025
summary: Sweden is expected to produce the world's first truly zero-carbon emission steel in 2025, marking a historic milestone. The steel industry faces challenges such as high energy costs and infrastructure needs for hydrogen-based production, while regulatory pressures like the EU’s Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism push for accelerated green technology investments.

title: Nation's green initiatives a catalyst for global change
summary: China has become a global leader in green technology innovation, including ultra-low emission steelmaking technologies that support clean and low-carbon transitions worldwide. The country has significantly expanded its new energy vehicle sector and renewable transitions, contributing to global green development momentum.

title: Electra Unveils Demonstration Facility along with Advanced Purchase Commitments for Clean Iron and Environmental Attributes
summary: Electra has launched a demonstration facility showcasing clean iron production technologies and secured advanced purchase commitments for clean iron and environmental attributes, highlighting progress in sustainable steelmaking innovations.

title: Steel Tech 2025: The event where steel, technology and innovation shape its future
summary: Steel Tech 2025 Congress & Expo in Bilbao gathered industry leaders and experts to discuss innovation, carbon-free energy sources, AI applications, and CO2 capture solutions in steelmaking. The event emphasized the transformation of the European steel industry towards sustainability and technological advancement.

title: Russia-Ukraine Peace Plan Progresses Step by Step, LME Copper Plunged Overnight
summary: LME copper opened at $10,639.5/mt, initially rose to $10,658.5/mt, then fell to a low of $10,542/mt before closing at $10,596.5/mt, down 1.08%. SHFE copper also declined, closing at 85,020 yuan/mt, down 0.6%, amid significant trading volume and open interest.

title: Copper falls on stronger dollar, muted demand from China
summary: Copper prices fell 0.3% to $15,175, pressured by a stronger US dollar and weaker demand from China, according to Reuters.

title: Arizona Sonoran Copper Company Releases Pre-Feasibility Study for Cactus Project
source: SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes via Metal.com
summary: Arizona Sonoran Copper Company announced a pre-feasibility study for its wholly-owned Cactus Project in Arizona, projecting annual copper cathode production of approximately 103,000 metric tons for the first ten years. The project is expected to become the third largest copper cathode production site in the US with an estimated annual EBITDA of about $574 million.

title: Atico Produces 2.24 Million Pounds of Copper and 1,906 Ounces of Gold in Q3 2025
summary: Atico Mining Corporation reported production of 2.24 million pounds of copper and 1,906 ounces of gold in concentrates for the third quarter of 2025, representing decreases of 23% and 8% respectively compared to the same period in 2024. The company revised its mine plan to include lower-grade ore from lower mine zones, expecting improved production in the following quarter.

title: Teck Reports Unaudited Third Quarter Results for 2025
summary: Teck's Q3 2025 copper production at its Quebrada Blanca (QB) mine was 39,600 tonnes, down 12,900 tonnes from the same period last year due to tailings management facility development causing concentrator downtime. Annual copper production guidance for 2025 at QB is between 170,000 and 190,000 tonnes, with ongoing improvements in ultra-fines removal and sand placement techniques to enhance operations.

title: Ageing Mines Tighten Global Copper Supply Lines
summary: Copper-in-concentrate production from the combined Kamoa-Kakula operation fell nearly 16% in Q2 2025 and a further 36% in Q3 2025, contributing to tighter global copper supply lines. The decline highlights challenges from ageing mines impacting overall copper availability in the market.

title: BHP Iron Ore and Copper Production Guidance Targets 2026
summary: BHP outlined its production guidance for iron ore and copper for 2026, emphasizing stable copper prices around USD $4.60 per pound driven by strong demand from energy transition applications. The company plans to focus on copper expansion projects and operational optimization amid supply-side constraints supporting price stability.

title: Southern Copper Corporation Secures Mining Licence for Tía María Project
summary: Southern Copper Corporation has obtained a mining licence for its USD 1.8 billion Tía María copper project in Peru's Arequipa region, advancing its development plans. This milestone supports the company's strategy to increase copper production capacity in the region.

title: BHP Resolution Copper Mine: 7 Innovations For 2025
summary: The article highlights innovations at BHP's Resolution Copper Mine, including automated drilling, advanced ore processing, and renewable energy integration, aimed at increasing efficiency and sustainability. These innovations are expected to enhance copper output while reducing environmental impact. The focus is on meeting rising global copper demand sustainably.

title: Copper Nickel Mining: 2026 Innovations For Sustainable Growth
summary: This piece discusses upcoming innovations in copper and nickel mining, such as autonomous equipment and water recycling systems, which are set to improve efficiency and reduce environmental impact. These technologies will play a crucial role in sustainable mining practices by 2026.

title: Gold, Silver & Copper: tech and sustainability trends
summary: The article explores how copper companies are leveraging technology and sustainability to address supply gaps. This includes using digital innovations, advanced mineral processing, and recycling to enhance production and reduce environmental impact.

title: Global nickel premiums stagnant amid falling LME nickel price
summary: The LME three-month nickel price closed at $16,316 per tonne on October 22, down from $17,424 per tonne a week earlier, marking the lowest close since September 18. Nickel premiums remained unchanged in China with thin liquidity, while import arbitrage losses slightly improved but remained negative.

title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
summary: Nickel prices dropped to a four-year low, falling as much as 2.3% to $15,235 per tonne on the LME, driven by a pessimistic Federal Reserve outlook and stronger dollar expectations. Despite Indonesia considering deep cuts to nickel mining quotas to support prices, the market remains pressured by new supply and slowing electric vehicle sales.

title: The world nickel market in 2025 – a growing surplus in an uncertain global landscape
summary: The International Nickel Study Group projects a growing surplus in the nickel market for 2025, with primary production expected to increase by 5.9% to 3.735 million tonnes, outpacing demand forecasted at 3.537 million tonnes. This surplus reflects ongoing uncertainties in global trade policies and raw material markets.

title: This 35-year-old is stockpiling $250,000 in nickels as a bet against inflation
summary: An individual is accumulating $250,000 worth of nickels as a hedge against inflation and potential future metal scarcity, despite nickel prices remaining unchanged this year. The strategy hinges on the possibility of coin debasement or increased metal value, although melting coins is currently illegal in the U.S.

title: Asian Battery Metals Unlocks Mongolia's Copper-Nickel Potential with BHP Backing and High-Grade Discoveries
summary: Asian Battery Metals reports encouraging metallurgical results from its Oval project in Mongolia, with copper recovery rates of 89–95% and concentrate grades of 18.5–24%, indicating strong economic potential. Nickel recovery is still being optimized, and the company is conducting detailed mineralogical studies in Japan and Australia to inform process design and assess byproduct potential from platinum group elements.

title: Nickel firm Anugrah Neo Energy eyes over $300 million IPO
summary: Indonesian nickel mining and processing company Anugrah Neo Energy Materials is planning an initial public offering (IPO) aiming to raise over $300 million. The move highlights growing investor interest in nickel production amid rising global demand for battery metals.

title: Cobalt And Nickel Mining Companies: 2026 Sustainable Trends
summary: By 2026, over 60% of cobalt and nickel mining companies will adopt sustainable extraction methods for battery supply chains. Innovations include real-time environmental monitoring using satellite imaging and AI, blockchain traceability for supply chain transparency, and increased recycling efforts to reduce dependence on virgin mining.

title: Copper Nickel Mining: 2026 Innovations For Sustainable Growth
summary: Copper and nickel mining continues to drive innovation, efficiency, and sustainability to support renewable energy and electric vehicle sectors. Technologies such as subscription-based satellite analytics, blockchain traceability, and carbon footprinting are being integrated to enhance environmental compliance and operational efficiency.

title: TECH Project high-grade nickel is primed to fuel the global green transition
summary: Queensland Pacific Metals’ TECH Project aims to become a leading source of high-grade, ethically derived nickel to support the green transition. The project focuses on sustainable production of nickel and other battery metals to meet growing demand for electric vehicles and renewable energy technologies.

title: Future Minerals Forum 2025: Transforming Global Mining Partnerships
summary: The forum highlights the critical role of nickel and other minerals in the energy transition and addresses supply chain vulnerabilities such as geographic concentration and processing capacity limitations. It emphasizes the need for innovation and sustainability initiatives to meet projected demand and secure supply chains.

title: EIB Pursuing Critical Minerals Investments in Australia
summary: The European Investment Bank is targeting investments in Australia's critical minerals sector, including nickel, focusing on mining, processing, and recycling. The article discusses opportunities for sustainable development and circular economy initiatives aligned with global climate goals.
